children.name: Proof of BPP via circuits
The inclusion circuits ⊆ BPP is immediate, so we focus on the converse inclusion.
keywords: The inclusion circuits ⊆ BPP is immediate, so we focus on the converse inclusion.

children.name: Consider a BPP algorithm, which is implemented by a Turing machine that runs in time p(n) and uses a coin tape.
keywords: Consider a BPP algorithm, which is implemented by a Turing machine that runs in time p(n) and uses a coin tape.

children.name: p
keywords: A computation can be visualised as a p(n) × p(n) grid

children.name: for every cell of the grid, its contents can be represented by log(states × alphabet) bits
keywords: for every cell of the grid, its contents can be represented by log(states × alphabet) bits

children.name: The n-th circuit computes the cells of the computation (in chronological order), and then says if the accepting state is seen.
keywords: The n-th circuit computes the cells of the computation (in chronological order), and then says if the accepting state is seen.

children.name: When the machine reads from the coin tape, a coin gate is used in the circuit.
keywords: When the machine reads from the coin tape, a coin gate is used in the circuit.

children.name: Fact. The following conditions are equivalent for a linear map
keywords: Fact. The following conditions are equivalent for a linear map

children.name: 2. if the input has norm 1, then the output output has norm 1

children.name: 3. the columns of the corresponding matrix are an orthonormal basis
keywords: 3. the columns of the corresponding matrix are an orthonormal basis

children.name: 4. the inverse of the corresponding matrix is its conjugate transpose.

keywords: Because quantum transformations must be reversible, number of input gates = number of output gates

children.name: A quantum circuit with n qubits is a sequence of quantum gates.

Definition: An k-qubit gate is any unitary linear map
